chapter.title: Reference 参考手册
chapter.para: Elements: 元素： Element access - Declares an access specification for class members 为类成员声明一个访问规格 Element boostbook - Defines a BoostBook book 定义一本 BoostBook 书 Element class - Declares a class or class template 声明一个类或类模板 Element class-specialization - A specialization (partial or full) of a class template 类模板的特化(偏特化或全特化) Element code - Mimics the code tag in HTML 模仿 HTML 中的 code 标签 Element compile-fail-test - A testcase that should fail to compile 一个会编译失败的测试案例 Element compile-test - A testcase that should compile correctly 一个可以正确编译的测试案例 Element complexity - The time/space/etc. complexity of a function 一个函数的时间/空间/等的复杂度 Element constructor - Declares a constructor of the enclosing class 声明所属类的构造函数 Element copy-assignment - Declares a copy-assignment operator 声明一个复制赋值操作符 Element data-member - Declares a data member of a class 声明一个类的数据成员 Element default - The default value of a function or template parameter 一个函数或模板的参数的缺省值 Element description - Detailed description of a construct 一个结构的详细说明 Element destructor - Declares a destructor for the enclosing class 声明所属类的析构函数 Element effects - Declares the side effects of a function 声明一个函数的副作用 Element enum - Declares an enumeration type 声明一个枚举类型 Element enumname - References an enumeration type with the given name 引用一个给定名字的枚举类型 Element enumvalue - A single value of an enumeration 枚举类型的单个值 Element free-function-group - A set of functions that are grouped together under one name 在同一个名字之下的一组函数 Element function - Declares a function 声明一个函数 Element functionname - References a function with the given name 引用带给定名字的函数 Element globalname - References a global with the given name 引用一个给定名字的全局变量 Element header - Declares a C++ header with the given name 声明给定名字的一个C++头文件 Element headername - References a C++ header with the given name 引用一个给定名字的C++头文件 Element if-fails - What it means when a testcase fails 当一个测试案例失败时意味着什么 Element inherit - Declares a base class of the enclosing class or struct 声明所属类或结构的基类 Element lib - A library dependency 一个库的依赖关系 Element library - Top-level element for a library 一个库的顶层元素 Element library-reference - Declares the reference material for a library 声明一个库的参考材料 Element librarycategory - Declares that the enclosing library is in this category 声明所属类属于这一类别 Element librarycategorydef - Defines a new library category 定义一个新的库类别 Element librarycategorylist - Categorized listing of libraries 库的分类列表 Element libraryinfo - Provides information about a library 提供有关一个库的信息 Element librarylist - Placeholder for an alphabetical list of libraries 用于库的字母序列表的占位符 Element libraryname - References a library of the given name 引用给定名字的库 Element librarypurpose - Describes in one short sentence or phrase the purpose of a library 用一句短句或短语描述库的用途 Element link-fail-test - Declares a test that should compile but fail to link 声明一个可以编译但不能链接的测试 Element link-test - Declares a test that should compile and link 声明一个可以编译和链接的测试 Element macroname - References a macro with the given name 引用一个给定名字的宏 Element method - Declares a method, i.e., a member function 声明一个方法，即一个成员函数 Element method-group - A set of methods that are grouped together under one name 在同一个名字之下的一组方法 Element namespace - Declares a namespace 声明一个名字空间 Element notes - Non-normative notes about a function's semantics 关于一个函数的语义的非标准化说明 Element overloaded-function - An overloaded function 一个重载的函数 Element overloaded-method - An overloaded method 一个重载的方法 Element parameter - A function parameter 一个函数参数 Element paramtype - The type of a function parameter 函数参数的类型 Element postconditions - Conditions that must hold after the function returns 在函数返回后必须满足的条件 Element precondition - Conditions that must be met prior to executing a function 在执行函数前必须被满足的条件 Element programlisting - A sample of program code 程序代码示例 Element purpose - A short description of an entity's use 一个实体用途的简短描述 Element rationale - Describes the rationale for a particular function's design 描述一个特定函数设计的原理 Element requirement - A requirement/property in the Jamfile for a testcase 一个测试案例的 Jamfile 中的要求/属性 Element requires - Declares the requirements of a function 声明一个函数的要求 Element returns - Description of the return value of a function 一个函数的返回值的说明 Element run-fail-test - A testcase that should compile and link, but fail on execution 一个可以编译和链接，但执行失败的测试案例 Element run-test - A testcase that should compile, link, and execute 一个可以编译、链接和执行成功的测试案例 Element signature - One signature of an overloaded function or method 一个重载函数或方法的签名 Element snippet - Pulls in a code snippet from a programlisting element 从一个 programlisting 元素取出的代码片断 Element source - Defines source code for a test 定义一个测试的源代码 Element specialization - Defines the specialization arguments for a class specialization 为一个特化类定义特化的参数 Element static-constant - Declares a static constant, e.g., const int foo = 5;. 定义一个静态常数，如 const int foo = 5; Element struct - Declares a C++ struct 声明一个C++结构 Element struct-specialization - A specialization (full or partial) of a struct template 一个结构模板的特化(全特化或偏特化) Element template - Declares the template parameters of a class or function 声明一个类或函数的模板参数 Element template-arg - A template argument in a specialization 在一个特化中的模板参数 Element template-nontype-parameter - A nontype template parameter 一个非类型模板参数 Element template-type-parameter - Declares a template type parameter 声明一个模板类型参数 Element template-varargs - Declares a variable-length list of template parameters 声明一个可变长度的模板参数列表 Element testsuite - Describes a library testsuite 描述一个库的测试套件 Element throws - Description of the exceptions thrown by a function 对由一个函数抛出的异常的说明 Element type - The type of an element or return type of a function 一个元素的类型或一个函数的返回类型 Element typedef - Declares a typedef 声明一个 typedef Element union - Declares a C++ union or union template 声明一个C++联合或联合模板 Element union-specialization - A specialization (full or partial) of a union template 一个联合模板的特化(全特化或偏特化) Element using-class - Injects the method and function names of a class into the local scope 将一个类的方法或函数名注入到本地作用域 Element using-namespace - Injects the declared names from a namespace into the local scope 将声明的名字从一个名字空间注入到本地作用域

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mimics the code tag in HTML 模仿 HTML 中的 code 标签

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Text within a code tag is generally typeset in a different, monospaced font so that it stands out as code. The code tag in BoostBook is transformed directly into the computeroutput tag in DocBook. code 标签内的文本通常都被排版为一种特别的、等宽的字体，这样看起来更象代码。 在 BoostBook 中的 code 标签会被直接转换为 DocBook 中的 computeroutput 标签。

refnamediv.refpurpose: Detailed description of a construct 一个结构的详细说明

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Although the context model for this element is ANY, detailed descriptions should contain structured DocBook elements that occur within sections, e.g., paragraphs (para, simpara), lists (orderedlist, itemizedlist), tables (informaltable, table), etc. 虽然该元素的上下文模型是 ANY，但是详细的说明应包括出现在一个章节中的结构化 DocBook 元素，如段落(para, simpara)，列表(orderedlist, itemizedlist)，表格(informaltable, table)，等等。

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Developers aren't generally expected to use this element. Its existence is mainly as a placeholder in boost.xml for the alphabetical list of libraries. 开发者通常不需要使用这一元素。它的存在主要是库的字母序列表所使用的在 boost.xml 中的占位符。

refnamediv.refpurpose: Declares the reference material for a library 声明一个库的参考资料

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Reference documentation for a library is contained with a <library-reference> element. The <library-reference> element has no attributes, and contains as children only <header> elements. 一个库的参考资料以一个 <library-reference> 元素包含。 <library-reference> 元素没有属性，只包含一个 <header> 元素。

The <header> element defines a C++ header file. Within each C++ header file lie the definitions of C++ constructs to be documented. The name attribute of the <header> element gives the name of the header, as one would specify when including the header. For instance, the <library-reference> for the Any library may look like this: <header> 元素定义了一个 C++ 头文件。在每个 C++ 头文件内部是被文档化的 C++ 结构的定义。 <header> 元素的 name 属性给出了头文件的名字，正如你在包含该头文件时要指定的一样。 例如，对 Any 库的 <library-reference> 如下：
refsection.programlisting: <library-reference> <header name="boost/any.hpp"> <!-- C++ constructs in this header --> </header> </library-reference>
refsection.para: If the Any library contained multiple headers, we would list them all as children of the <library-reference> element. 如果 Any 库包含多个头文件，我们应该把它们全部列在 <library-reference> 元素中。

library-reference elements can be nested, so that reference material can be divided into separate sections that each contain different headers. library-reference 元素可以嵌套，所以参考资料可以被分为多个独立章节，每个章节包含不同的头文件。

refnamediv.refpurpose: Declares a variable-length list of template parameters 声明一个可变长度的模板参数列表

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Variable-length template parameter lists are not allowed in C++, but because they are sometimes needed in documentation they are allowed in BoostBook. This element generally expands to "..." and can be used anywhere any other template parameter can be used. 可变长度的模板参数列表在C++中并不被允许，但是由于它们在文档中有时候是需要的，所以在 BoostBook 中是可用的。 该元素通常扩展为 "..."，可以在任何其它模板参数可用的地方使用。

refnamediv.refpurpose: Defines source code for a test 定义一个测试的源代码

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para:
This element will contain the source code for a testcase that will be generated from the documentation. To reduce the amount of escaping in the text, it is recommended to use CDATA sections, which look like this: 该元素包含从文档生成的测试案例的源代码。为减少文本中的转义符数量，建议使用 CDATA 节，如下：
<![CDATA[ <your program text here: no escaping needed!> ]]>
In addition to CDATA sections, code snippets can be pulled in from programlisting elements using the snippet element. 除了 CDATA 节，代码片断也可以使用 snippet 元素从 programlisting 元素中取出。

refnamediv.refpurpose: Declares a function 声明一个函数

refentry.refsynopsisdiv: function ::= (template?, type, parameter*, purpose?, description?, requires?, effects?, postconditions?, returns?, throws?, complexity?, notes?, rationale?)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: BoostBook functions are documented by specifying the function's interface (e.g., its C++ signature) and its behavior. Constructors, destructors, member functions, and free functions all use the same documentation method, although the top-level tags differ. BoostBook 中的函数通过指定函数的接口(如它的 C++ 签名)及其行为来文档化。 构造函数、析构函数、成员函数和普通函数都使用相同的文档化方法，虽然它们的顶层标签不相同。

The behavior of functions in BoostBook is documenting using a style similar to that of the C++ standard, with clauses describing the requirements, effects, postconditions, exception behavior, and return values of functions. 在 BoostBook 中，函数的行为是以类似于C++标准的方式来记录的，以各个子句来描述函数的要求、作用、后置条件、异常行为和返回值。

The following example illustrates some constructors and a destructor for boost::any. Note that one of the constructors takes a single parameter whose name is "other" and whose type, const any& is contained in the <paramtype> element; any number of parameters may be specified in this way. 以下例子示范了 boost::any 的一些构造函数和析构函数。 注意，其中一个构造函数接受单个参数，参数名为 "other"，参数的类型为 const any&，在 <paramtype> 元素中包含；以这种方式可以指定任意数量的参数。
refsection.programlisting: empty()> const any& Copy constructor that copies content of other into the new instance, so that any content is equivalent in both type and value to the content of other, or empty if other is empty. May fail with a std::bad_alloc exception or any exceptions arising from the copy constructor of the contained type. Releases any and all resources used in management of instance. Nothing.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: BoostBook namespaces are declared via the <namespace> element. As in C++, namespaces can be nested and contain other C++ constructs, such as classes or functions. The name attribute of a <namespace> element gives the namespace name (e.g., "boost"). The Any library is defined entirely within namespace boost by: BoostBook 名字空间通过 <namespace> 元素声明。和 C++ 一样，名字空间可以嵌套，可以包含其它 C++ 结构，如类或函数。 <namespace><namespace> 元素的 name 属性给出名字空间的名字(如 "boost")。 以下将 Any 库定义在名字空间 boost 内：
refsection.programlisting: <library-reference> <header name="boost/any.hpp"> <namespace name="boost"> <!-- C++ constructs in the boost namespace --> </namespace> </header> </library-reference>

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A requirement is part of the dependencies of a target in a Jamfile. The name attribute of a requirement element gives the name of the Boost.Build feature and the content of the requirement gives the value of that feature. A requirement such as <includes>foo.hpp would be encoded as <requirement name="includes">foo.hpp</requirement>. 在 Jamfile 中，要求是一个目标的依赖关系的一部分。 要求元素的 name 属性给出了 Boost.Build 特性的名字，而要求中的内容则给出了该特性的值。 例如， <includes>foo.hpp 的要求可以编码为 <requirement name="includes">foo.hpp</requirement>.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Declares a class or class template 声明一个类或类模板

refentry.refsynopsisdiv: class ::= (template?, inherit*, purpose?, description?, (access| static-constant| typedef| enum| copy-assignment| constructor| destructor| method-group| free-function-group| function| method| overloaded-function| overloaded-method| data-member| class| class-specialization| struct| struct-specialization| union| union-specialization)*)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: C++ classes and class templates are described via the <class> element. Each class has a name (e.g., "any") given by the name attribute, a purpose given by the <purpose> element, documentation, and a set of types, functions, base classes, and data members. Here is a minimal definition of the boost::any class: C++ 类和类模板是通过 <class> 元素描述的。每个类都有一个名字(如 "any")，由 name 属性给出，其用途由 <purpose> 元素给出，还有相应的文档、一组类型、函数、基类和数据成员。 以下是 boost::any 类的一个最小定义：
refsection.programlisting: <namespace name="boost"> <class name="any"> <purpose> A class whose instances can hold instances of any type that satisfies ValueType requirements. </purpose> </class> </namespace>
refsection.para: Additional class documentation can be contained in a description element following the <purpose> element. This documentation will be typeset prior to documentation for specific elements in the class (e.g., constructors or methods). 类的其它文档可以包含在一个 description 元素中，跟在 <purpose> 元素之后。 这些文档将被排版在该类中其它特定元素(如构造函数或方法)之前。

Class inheritance is described via the <inherit> element. The <inherit> element requires an access attribute which must be one of public, protected, or private. The content of the <inherited> element in C++ code that names the class inherited, and may contain markup to link to the class. The following description of the class boost::bad_any_cast describes public inheritance from the class std::bad_cast. It also defines the <purpose> element, which contains a short description of the use of the class. 类的继承关系通过 <inherit> 元素描述。<inherit> 元素需要一个 access 属性，它必定是 public, protected, 或 private 之一。 在C++代码中的 <inherit> 元素的内容表示被继承的类，可以包含链接到该类的标记。 以下对类 boost::bad_any_cast 的描述表明它公有继承自类 std::bad_cast。 它还定义了 <purpose> 元素，其中包含对于该类的用途的简短说明。
refsection.programlisting: <class name="bad_any_cast"> <inherit access="public"><classname>std::bad_cast</classname></inherit> <purpose><para>The exception thrown in the event of a failed <functionname>any_cast</functionname> of an <classname>any</classname> value.</para></purpose> </class>
refsection.para: Class templates are defined by <class> elements with a <template> child element at the beginning. 类模板也通过 <class> 元素定义，但在开始处需带一个 <template> 子元素。

refnamediv.refpurpose: Defines a new library category 定义一个新的库类别

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: All library category definitions should be in doc/src/boost.xml, and the names of categories must be prefixed with "category:". 所有的库类别定义都应在 doc/src/boost.xml 中，而且类别名必须以 "category:" 为前缀。
